title: Chelsea plot £25million summer bid to re-sign Ryan Bertrand from Southampton
text:
RYAN BLUE-TURN Chelsea plot £25million summer bid to re-sign Ryan Bertrand from Southampton 
Antonio Conte keen to pile pressure on wing-backs Marcos Alonso and Victor Moses as Blues eye Champions League Gossip Comments CHELSEA are keen to re-sign left-back Ryan Bertrand from Southampton. 
Boss Antonio Conte wants more competition in the wing-back and full-back ranks, and sees Bertrand as an ideal addition to his squad. Reuters Ryan Bertrand…Chelsea want him back 
According to the Evening Standard, the Italian manager is a “huge admirer” of Bertrand. 
Keep up to date with ALL the CHELSEA news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The England defender was originally sold to Saints for £10 million in 2015, but he’s likely to cost considerably more now. 
Bertrand’s current contract runs to 2021, and the south-coast club value him at over £25million. Since leaving Stamford Bridge, Bertrand has established himself as one of the finest left-backs in the Premier League. 
Chelsea’s springboard towards the Prem title was the introduction of a 3-4-3 system using Marcos Alonso and Victor Moses as the wing-backs. Reuters Bertrand in action for Southampton against Chelsea Reuters Facing the media with England boss Gareth Southgate PA:Press Association 4 Antonio Conte…impressed by Bertrand’s wing-back credentials 
Conte has precious little cover here, though, and is also conscious that Chelsea will have many extra matches next season as they are destined to return to the Champions League after a year out of Europe. 
Bertand has scored one goal and made four assists this season and has shown himself to be a highly-rated attacking force whose defensive duties are never overlooked. Sunday Premier League match preview featuring Arsenal v Man City
